content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 82.4 - Negative amortization (deferral and capitalization)

State Regulations

During the term of the loan the loan-to-value ratio may
increase above the initial loan-to-value ratio if the increase results from a
change authorized under sections 82.3 and
82.2
(b) of this

Part, but the loan balance may not exceed 125 percent of the original appraised
value of the property unless the loan contract provides that the payment shall
be adjusted at least once every five years, beginning no later than the tenth
year of the loan, to a level sufficient to amortize the loan at the then
existing interest rate and loan balance over the remaining term of the
loan. Notes
